document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genera Acrosathe Irwin and Lyneborg, Arenigena Irwin and Lyneborg, and Litolinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) from the Nearctic Region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genera Acrosathe Irwin and Lyneborg, Arenigena Irwin and Lyneborg, and Litolinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) from the Nearctic Region

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
semitaria Coquillett (1893a:197
key, 198 male desc., 199 fem. desc.),

Arenigena
). Type locality southern California . Lectotype male in USNM.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Arenigena semitaria
is similar to
A. albiseta
and
A. floridensis
in the male having the inner gonocoxal process bilobed ( Fig. 90 ). It differs from
A. albiseta
and
A. floridensis
in having the wing veins and cross-veins with a brown margin; the proepimeron lacking setae; the male sternite 8 with setae absent medially on posterior margin ( Fig. 89 ); the gonostylus ( Fig. 91 ) with short, dark brown macrosetae apically and with an apical tuft of elongate setae; and the furca ( Fig. 95 ) with anterior margin tridentate in appearance.

Head. Length 0.90–1.08, 1.00 mm. Ocellar tubercle dark reddish brown, pubescence gray, dense; setae pale yellow, short. Frons pubescence white, dense. Antenna yellow, second and third flagellomeres dark brown; antenna/head length 0.52–0.71, 0.66; scape length 0.16–0.20, 0.19 mm , width 0.12–0.16, 0.14 mm , length/width 1.1–1.7, 1.4, scape/pedicel length 1.6–2.5, 2.3, scape/flagellum width 0.7–0.9, 0.7, setae white yellow, short; pedicel length 0.08–0.10, 0.08 mm , width 0.12–0.16, 0.14 mm , length/width 0.5–0.7, 0.6; flagellum (apical portion of first flagellomere short, thick), length 0.35–0.44, 0.41 mm , width 0.18–0.20, 0.19 mm , length/width 1.9–2.4, 2.2, flagellum/scape length 1.9–2.5, 2.2. Parafacial pubescence yellowish gray. Gena pubescence whitish gray; setae white, elongate. Maxillary palpus yellow; length 0.38–0.48, 0.45 mm , width 0.06–0.08, 0.07 mm , length/width 5.5–7.5, 6.1; setae white to pale yellow, elongate. Occipital setae white, elongate abundant dorsally.

Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1–2 dc. Mesonotum dull brownish gray; setae white, elongate. Pleuron pubescence gray, dense; setae white, elongate on propleuron, proepimeron (occasionally absent), anepisternum, katepisternum (setae in band along anterior margin), laterotergite, metanepisternum, and scutellum. Wing. Membrane pale whitish gray, veins brown with brown spot at fork of R 4+5 , r-m, apex of discal cell, apex of cells bm and cup ; length 5.7–6.8, 6.4 mm , width 1.8–2.6, 2.3 mm , length/width 2.6–3.2, 2.8; pterostigma dark brown. Legs. Coxae pubescence white, dense; setae white, elongate. Femora dark reddish brown, pubescence white; ventral setae white, elongate, dorsal setae white, appressed. Tibiae yellow. Tarsi 1 dark yellow; 2–5 brown.
FEMALE . Similar to male except for following. Variation (n=6).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 88–95.
Arenigena semitaria .
88. Tergite 8, epandrium, cerci. 89. Sternite 8, gonocoxite ventral view. 90. Gonocoxite, lateral view. 91. Gonostylus lateral view. 92. Aedeagus, dorsal view. 93. Aedeagus, ventral view. 94. Aedeagus, lateral view. 95. Female internal reproductive organs. Scale = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head. Length 0.94–1.18, 1.01 mm . Frons pubescence whitish to yellowish gray, dense; setae pale yellow, short, appressed. Antenna/head length 0.59–0.72, 0.68; scape length 0.18–0.24, 0.20 mm , width 0.14–0.18, 0.15 mm , length/width 1.1–1.4, 1.3, scape/pedicel length 2.3–2.7, 2.4, scape/flagellum width 0.8–0.9, 0.8; pedicel length 0.08–0.10, 0.08 mm , width 0.14–0.18, 0.15 mm , length/width 0.5–0.6, 0.6; flagellum length 0.36–0.4, 0.40 mm , width 0.16–0.20, 0.19 mm , length/width 2.0–2.4, 2.2, flagellum/scape length 1.8–2.4, 2.0. Maxillary palpus length 0.46–0.50, 0.47 mm , width 0.08–0.10, 0.09 mm , length/width 5.0–5.8, 5.6.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1–2 dc. Wing. Length 6.2–7.8, 7.0 mm, width 2.0–2.7, 2.4 mm , length/ width 2.7–3.1, 2.9.

Abdomen. Yellowish brown, pubescence white (occasionally dark reddish brown); dorsal setae pale yellow, appressed on tergites 1–4, dark reddish brown, short on tergites 5–8.
Terminalia
(MEI 170267). Furca
( Fig. 95 ), oval, anterior margin broad, expanded anteriorly, anterolateral projection short; length 0.54 mm , width 0.36 mm .

Distribution.
Arenigena semitaria
is known from Arizona , California , Idaho , Nevada , Oregon , Utah , and Wyoming ( Fig. 96 ).

Habitats and Phenology.
Arenigena semitaria
has been hand-netted or collected in pitfall or Malaise traps set in dry riverbeds or sand dunes. Adults have been collected from May through August.

Specimens examined. Type specimens.
Coquillett described
Thereva semitaria
based on 11 males and four females deposited in the USNM ( Type No. 10421). Only one male specimen of this series could be located. This syntype male is labeled "5 31,
Los Angeles Co. Cal.
, Coquillett Collection" and is in the USNM ( Type No. 10421) (MEI 114021). This lectotype is designated in order to fix the concept of
Thereva semitaria Coquillett
and to ensure universal and consistent interpretation of the same.
